posts.name: Alberto Jahuey Moncada
posts.cooked:
We are trying to use the Limelight with PhotonVision for aiming our shooter, we wanted to use the resolution of 960x720 but we found a weird problem that we haven’t been able to solve. Whenever we place something in front of the camera, and that object reflects a lot of the green light, the whole color scheme changes, we think its something related to the gain.  We tried to use v4l2-ctl to see if we can move any configurations and set everything to manual, but that didn’t fix the issue.

The weird thing is that it only happens with that resolution (960x720). Can anyone help us??

Attached is a video of the issue: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NfuzkZshTnA (Edit: Changed title of video to Limelight, went on autopilot and wrote Lifecam)

posts.name: Declan
posts.cooked: That is indeed odd and very much a bug. The reason v4l2-ctl doesn’t do anything is because the GPU accelerated camera provider does not go through v4l2 and calls MMAL directly. I will try and take a look at reproducing on my Gloworm which has similar hardware (and cc @bankst — I know you have a LL so if you could see if this is reproducible that would be great).

posts.name: Newton Crosby Jr
posts.cooked: I think that may just be the camera adjusting it’s aperture or shutter speed to accommodate for the extra light. That is weird that it is only occurring on 960x720 though.

posts.custom_user_title: Now availible on DVD and Blu-Ray!

posts.name: Alberto Jahuey Moncada
posts.cooked: Yeah its very odd, we re-imaged the Limelight and the issue still persists, for now we have been using a lower resolution but it would be nice to use that one
Given the color change, I think it’s changing the white balance, but only in 1 direction.

posts.name: Matt

PhotonVision V2022.1.5 PhotonVision

posts.name: Alberto Jahuey Moncada
posts.cooked: We are now using the official Limelight image, will look into whether or not the issue was fixed after our first event!

posts.name: Declan
posts.cooked: To clarify: I reproduced and fixed the color change issue, which was exactly as described here. It was because the OV5647 video mode 6 at this FPS and upscaling is bugged in the Pi firmware. I’m pretty confident that the issue should be gone in 2022.1.5; I would love extra confirmation though, so if you do test it then please drop a reply here.

posts.name: Alberto Jahuey Moncada
posts.cooked: Will certainly test it once we have enough time, thanks for looking into it!
